intro: Canthium parasiebenlistii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forests or along stream banks. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
